question: What happens to the velocity of a heavy body when it undergoes an elastic collision in one dimension with a very light body at rest?
option1: it stops and comes to rest
option2: it keeps on moving with the same velocity
option3: it starts moving with half of its initial velocity
option4: it rebounds with the same velocity
answer: it keeps on moving with the same velocity
explanation: The heavy body keeps on moving with the same velocity when it undergoes an elastic collision in one dimension with a very light body at rest. Note: the body at rest starts moving with double the initial velocity of the heavy body.
